etymology.description: Ideogram: formed by adding a horizontal stroke to ancient 舌 to show tongue movement (speech). Shuowen erroneously treats it as phono-semantic: phonetic 䇂 (qiān) + semantic 口 (“mouth”).
etymology.interpretation: Built on 舌 (tongue), an added stroke marks motion, abstracting the act of speaking into a simple sign for “speech/words.” Later standardization added a dot on top and simplified the tongue shape, moving from a pictorial tongue to a conventional symbol for utterance. The Shuowen’s phono-semantic reading is a historical misinterpretation rather than the true origin.

examples.chinese: 请注意你的言语(請注意你的言語)。
他发言很简短(他發言很簡短)。
言行一致(言行一致)，方能取信于人(方能取信於人)。
examples.pinyin: Yán xíng yízhì, fāng néng qǔxìn yú rén.
examples.english: Only by matching words with deeds can one gain others’ trust.
